<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get ticket sources"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tickets/sources"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves all available ticket source types configured for the site. Sources indicate how tickets were created (e.g., web portal, email, phone, API, mobile app) and are useful for analytics, routing rules, and reporting on ticket origin channels.

**Workflow Example**
1. List sources: [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/sources](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket-sources) → retrieve available source types
2. Use for filtering: Include `SourceId` in [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) to filter by origin
3. Use for reporting: Group ticket metrics by source to analyze channel performance

**Response Fields**: Each source includes `SourceId`, `Name`, `Description`, and whether it's the default source.

**Use Cases**: Building source dropdowns for ticket creation, analyzing ticket volume by channel, configuring routing rules based on ticket origin.

**Related Endpoints**
- [POST /api/v1.0/tickets](/docs/api/tickets/search-tickets) – Filter tickets by SourceId
- [POST /api/v1.0/tickets/new](/docs/api/tickets/create-ticket) – Create ticket with specific source
- [GET /api/v1.0/tickets/\{ticketId\}](/docs/api/tickets/get-ticket) – View ticket's source
